CALCIUM CARBONATE

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ custom_padding=”0px||0px|||” collapsed=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.4.7″ custom_padding=”64px||6px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.4.7″ text_font=”Lato||on||||||” text_text_color=”#004A4F” text_font_size=”22px” text_letter_spacing=”0.5px” text_line_height=”1.4em” text_orientation=”center” width=”100%” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”||35px||false|false” custom_padding=”25px||||false|false” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”16px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”]

“With GMCI Calcium Carbonate, we can deliver creative improver skills to satisfy the needs of your Paper, Rubber, Paint / Coating and many more applications.”

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,2_3″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ width=”90%” max_width=”95%” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”|67px||auto||” custom_padding=”36px||3px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ border_width_right=”1px” border_color_right=”#ffffff” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://www.gmciltd.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Calcium-Carbonate-3.jpg” title_text=”Calcium Carbonate 3″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ custom_margin=”||-26px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.4.7″ text_font=”Lato||||||||” text_text_color=”#000000″ text_font_size=”19px” text_line_height=”1.5em” header_5_font=”Lato|||on|||||” header_5_text_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.85)” background_color=”#ffffff” width=”95%” module_alignment=”right” custom_padding=”10px|20px|10px|20px|true|true” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Natural Stone

We can commit to offering all our esteemed clients the best quality (CACO3: 98.5 %; Whiteness: 98 % min; Brightness: 96% min)

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://www.gmciltd.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Calcium-Carbonate-1.jpg” title_text=”Calcium Carbonate 1″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ custom_margin=”||-26px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.4.7″ text_font=”Lato||||||||” text_text_color=”#000000″ text_font_size=”19px” text_line_height=”1.5em” header_5_font=”Lato|||on|||||” header_5_text_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.85)” background_color=”#ffffff” width=”95%” module_alignment=”right” custom_padding=”10px|20px|10px|20px|true|true” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Highest production potential and value

We now are India’s largest exporter with an export capacity of up to 20,000 MT / month. Our material is internationally recognised in consistency, and is used in 40 countries worldwide.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://www.gmciltd.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Calcium-Carbonate-2.jpg” title_text=”Calcium Carbonate 2″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ custom_margin=”||-26px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.4.7″ text_font=”Lato||||||||” text_text_color=”#000000″ text_font_size=”19px” text_line_height=”1.5em” header_5_font=”Lato|||on|||||” header_5_text_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.85)” background_color=”#ffffff” width=”95%” module_alignment=”right” custom_padding=”10px|20px|10px|20px|true|true” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Outstanding Service

Quick shipping is conducted just 10-15 days after order approval and our customer service metrics are strictly tracked after delivery.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”2_3″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.4.7″ text_font=”Lato|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#004B4F” text_font_size=”19px” text_letter_spacing=”0.5px” text_line_height=”1.6em” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”20px||||false|false” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|67|67|100|4|0|-4″ text_text_color_tablet=”” text_text_color_phone=”” text_text_color_last_edited=”on|phone” text_font_size_tablet=”19px” text_font_size_phone=”17px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_orientation_tablet=”center” text_orientation_phone=”center” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Calcium carbonate is one of the most abundant minerals on Earth, Responsible for around 4 percent of the Surface. Calcium carbonate is a natural mineral provided by high-purity white minerals from the richest stone belts. It’s perfect for beauty purposes. Distribution of particle size 5.5 μm. Fine white powder, chalky flavour, fragrant. Barely water soluble.

There are three primary forms of rock in nature: chalk, limestone and marble.

→   Natural, White and Pure

Pure Calcium carbonate up to 99% is a fine powdered Calcite super white material. This is commonly found in insecticides and paints. Calcite powder as lumps, fine coated / uncoated powder is required in plastics, cement, metal polish and calcium carbide. There are numerous “Micron Carb” sequence classes, of different sizes and brightness’s. The required specification grades are in comparison to the Micronase grades, in top cuts of 5, 10, 15 & 20 microns, from 300 Mesh to 700 Mesh BSS Norm.

We owe our achievements to our strong quality contribution and our goods meet with foreign requirements. Our Calcium Carbonate superior quality is compatible with price, and the reason for having long lasting ties with our customers is due to their strong expectations and our reasonable pricing.

→   Ground Calcium Carbonate (GCC)

Typically produced more than an immense amount of years.

Ground Calcium Carbonate (GCC) is made up of a natural crystalline stone, calcite, in the shape of chalk, marble or calcite. Chalk typically ranges in fine texture from deposit to deposit and is in color. Marble deposits are calcareous stones modified to intense heat and pressures by crystallization. This natural cycle often produces an incredible whiteness of pure marble.

→   Precipitated Calcium Carbonate (PCC)

Made by people very quickly

Precipitated Calcium Carbonate (PCC) is indeed a lime product for various industries. PCC is produced by moisturizing high-calcium fast lime and then by reacting with carbon dioxide to the resultant slurry, or “lime milk.” In the PCC process, substances varying from ultra-low to very high powder densities may be produced with very limited measurements, high surface areas, higher oil absorption and/or specific powder bulk content.

excerpt.rendered: ProductsCALCIUM CARBONATE“With GMCI Calcium Carbonate, we can deliver creative improver skills to satisfy the needs of your Paper, Rubber, Paint / Coating and many more applications.”Natural Stone We can commit to offering all our esteemed clients the best quality (CACO3: 98.5 %; Whiteness: 98 % min; Brightness: 96% min)Highest production potential and value We now […]
